I love pac-man we've done pac-man and

simple effect using basic ingredients
and Oreo cookies today let's get started
the things that you'll need for today's

mould today you can buy these at a lot
of different cakes supply stores but if
you don't have an Oreo mould you can

or a muffin pan I've decided to use

over here I've got a couple of jumbo
love heart sprinkles and a couple of
mini M&Ms so let's get started the first
thing that you want to do is we're going
to do just like a little base layer
inside our little Oreo container so what
you want to do is you just want to take
about that a teaspoon or so of that
melted yellow and just dab it in to your
little molds and working quite quickly
before they start to set you want to
give them a couple of really good hard
smacks on the bench so what you're
looking for there is a really nice
coating of that white chocolate or
yellow chocolate in the base of your
Oreo molds pop that off into the fridge
and let that completely set alright so
coming back from the fridge and your
little tiny you can see how thin they
are just you're really thin disks should
have set don't jumble those around too
much because you don't want them to come
popping out of their little containers
but you want to take now just another
like a 1/2 teaspoon or so of that melted
chocolate and pop it in the center do
this one or two at a time because you
don't want that to start setting on your
cold Oreo top and then push your Oreo
cookie right the way down the reason
that I do it this way with that little
disc at the top is because otherwise
when you push the Oreo down it tends to
go a little bit wonky and a little bit
out of shape and sometimes you'll see
the Oreo through the top coat of your
chocolate so by doing this little
chocolate disk first it stops you from
seeing that little Oreo coming through
and it keeps you
nice and flat and straight perfect now
you just want to fill in the rest of
your little Oreo containers but you
don't want to go over the outside line
of your little Oreo mold if you can
avoid it so you want to make sure that
your chocolates drizzling all the way
down the sides of your Oreos you can
sort of push it down we're going to give

that chocolate in there all right now
once again before they start to set to
much we're going to give those a whole

lift it up and have a look around your
little edges and make sure that you
can't see any little gaps like this
little pocket just here if you see any
of those just keep on tapping perfect so
I'm pretty happy that I filtered all of

so you want to take your sharp knife now
and I'm going to pop that in that really
really hot water this is going to be to
heat the knife up coming back from the

completely set so you can pop those out
one of the advantages of using this Oreo
mold is that when they do pop out
they're actually really nice and shiny
which you're not going to get the same

tray try to avoid touching the tops of
your pac-man too much touch the sides
that's fine but anywhere that you touch
them you are going to leave little
finger marks and you don't really want
